intro: Moquiniastrum polymorphum subsp. floccosum, commonly known as the fluffgrass, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense, fluffy inflorescences. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
